name: 英語閱讀與寫作
comment: 進階英語課程，供非英語系同學選修
description: 透過廣泛性閱讀活動增進學生英語字彙量以及對各類型文章的鑑賞、分析及擷取重要資訊的能力；並透過各式寫作活動，培養學生用英文寫出自己想法的能力。
goals: 強化學生英語文聆聽、閱讀、口語、寫作的表達能力，協助獲取新知。
提昇學生英語文進階溝通能力及文學素養。
syllabus:
Reading and Writing

Spring 2019 Syllabus

Instructor: Chingshun J. Sheu 許景順 ([cjsheu@ntnu.edu.tw](mailto:cjsheu@ntnu.edu.tw))

Registration: Before or during the first class meeting.

Class meetings: Wednesdays 1320-1510

Assigned texts: “Frozen Alive,” “The Books We Don’t Understand,” “Citius, Altius, Frigidiores,” and “On Pandering”; to be provided by the instructor.

Objectives: Students will learn how to write an essay including narrative, explanatory, and argumentative elements. They will also learn to appreciate the use of these elements in essays by their peers and published writers.

Grading:        60% Essays

                        25% Integrated essay

15% Weekly journal

Essays: Students will write three essays (respectively narrative, explanatory, and argumentative) and submit each to peers for review before handing it in to the instructor. Further revision may be granted extra credit. _Plagiarism will result in an essay grade of 0 (zero)._

Integrated essay: Students will write an essay integrating narrative, explanatory, and/or argumentative elements and submit it to peers and the instructor for review before handing it in to be graded. _No late submissions will be accepted._ _Plagiarism will result in an essay grade of 0 (zero)_.

Weekly journal: Students will submit one journal entry each for fifteen weeks prior to the final week. A journal entry will be graded based solely on whether it has been submitted. Submitting more than fifteen journal entries may result in extra credit. _Plagiarized journal entries will not be counted_.
